required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prospective Feasibility Trial of AccuCath 2.25" BC Placed in Difficult Access Patients in the Emergency Department
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective Feasibility Trial of AccuCath 2.25" BC Intravascular Catheter System With Retractable Coiled Tip Guidewire Placed in Difficult Access Patients in the Emergency Department

brief_summary.textblock: Study objective is to evaluate user preference, time for procedure, insertion success rates, complications, completion of therapy and dwell time of the AccuCath 2.25" BC device placed in difficult IV access patients in the emergency department.

detailed_description.textblock:
A one arm, prospective feasibility study using the AccuCath 2.25" BC Intravascular Catheter System placed in the upper arm with ultrasound guidance, and the lower arm with and without ultrasound guidance based on clinical assessment. Subjects will be subjected to a maximum of 4 attempts. If unsuccessful by the 4th attempt, alternatives will be considered as per current standard of care.
Currently multiple IV attempts are made in difficult IV access patients without success. Patients are often escalated to more invasive lines due to the need for longer catheters without clinical indication. The study will evaluate the feasibility of AccuCath 2.25" BC as a low risk, lower cost alternative for this patient population in lieu of using a midline, peripherally inserted central line or central venous catheter when not clinically required for purposes of therapy.

primary_outcome.time_frame: At initial IV insertion attempt, generally from 3-15 minutes
primary_outcome.description: Number of catheters attempts required to achieve successful insertion on difficult IV access patients

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At initial IV insertion attempt through successful cannulation, generally from 3-15 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: Time will be measured from initial vessel insertion through successful cannulation

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During IV dwell from initial insertion success through IV removal, usually ranges from 7-14 days but could be up to 29 days
secondary_outcome.description: Count of IV complications that require IV removal before completion of therapy. Includes infiltration, extravasation, phlebitis, occlusion, dislodgement, infection, leaking at site, pain at site

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During IV dwell from initial insertion success through IV removal, usually ranges from 7-14 days but could be up to 29 days
secondary_outcome.description: IV dwell time in days/hours until IV is no longer needed or complicates. Includes a count of catheter days.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During IV dwell from initial insertion success through IV removal, usually ranges from 7-14 days but could be up to 29 days
secondary_outcome.description: Count of whether the catheter lasted for the duration of intended therapy without complication requiring early removal.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From IV insertion through removal. Generally ranges from 3 minutes up to 29 days maximum.
secondary_outcome.description: Costs of IV therapy compared to alternatives if the AccuCath 2.25" device was not used. These include multiple unsuccessful PIV attempts, non-clinically indicated midlines, PICCs or Central lines.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At end of IV insertion, first 3-15 minutes of procedure and IV removal, which can by up to a maximum of 29 days
secondary_outcome.description: Likert scale 1-5 measurement of satisfaction with overall IV insertion experience and again at removal with overall IV performance.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At end of IV insertion, first 3-15 minutes of procedure and IV removal, which can by up to a maximum of 29 days
secondary_outcome.description: Likert scale 1-5 measurement of satisfaction by IV inserter and again by nurses caring for patient on inpatient unit, completed by the nurse removing the catheter.

other_outcome.measure: Number of Attempts Prior to AccuCath 2.25" Use
other_outcome.time_frame: Number of IV attempts made before patient identified as difficult access and enrolled in study, could range from 3-30 minutes during initial procedure attempts
other_outcome.description: Count of catheter attempts during initial insertion before patient identified as difficult IV access

arm_group.description: Use of AccuCath 2.25" BC peripheral IV device for difficult IV access in emergency room patients who have had 2 previous attempts, identified as difficult IV access from patient history or non-palpable, non-visible veins.

intervention.description: Long peripheral IV catheter designed for difficult IV access patients requiring deeper vessel access, often used with ultrasound guidance.

facility.name: North Shore - Long Island Jewish Health System
